nodes.description: creating deep change in our economy and politics—placing power in the hands of people and uprooting legacies of harm—so that a fundamentally new system can take root

nodes.description: systematically address how to respond to the current waves of disruptive change from a deep place that connects us to the emerging future rather than by reacting against the patterns of the past

nodes.description: make cities safer by encouraging equal access to public spaces for everyone especially women, through the use of crowdsourced data and technology

nodes.description: reduce poverty in developing countries by using our unique Prosperity Wages® model to pay for artisan products

nodes.description: supports societies to resist violence and division & to build a positive future

nodes.description: Soft skills, including conf

nodes.description: Bay Area non-profit, focused on creating global opportunity

nodes.description: Combat fearmongering through elder statesman, UA alumni network

nodes.description: Independent new media company

nodes.description: Takes a disruptive approach to media to bring inclusive messages to a rapidly changing landscape

nodes.label: American Immigration Council
nodes.description: Promotes justice for immigrants while combatting divisive media narratives

nodes.label: Center for Media Engagement University of Texas Austin
nodes.description: Measure superior online discourse, understand metri types

nodes.label: HopeLab
nodes.description: Medically-oriented interventions to counter-act suffering

nodes.label: Humanity United
nodes.description: Stop systemic violence impacting humans

nodes.label: UnityWorks
nodes.description: Promote shared fortunes, destiny of human race

nodes.label: AMAZE
nodes.description: AMAZE programs foster the knowledge, values, and skills that the next generation needs in order to support and respect each other across differences of race, class, culture, gender, sexual orientation, age, religion/faith, and physical ability.

nodes.label: Anti Racist Alliance
nodes.description: an organizing collective of human service practitioners and educators whose vision is to bring a clear and deliberate anti-racist structural power analysis to social service education and practice.

nodes.label: Border Crossers: Racial Justice in Education
nodes.description: Border Crossers utilizes creative tools to encourage educators in explorations of race and racism with K-12 students.

nodes.label: Californians For Justice
nodes.description: Californians for Justice believes that young people are the leaders we need to create the healthy, just and vibrant schools all of our communities deserve.

nodes.label: Coleman Advocates for Youth
nodes.description: Coleman Advocates believes that all children and families deserve access to high quality education, living wage jobs, family-supporting benefits, affordable housing, and a voice in the decisions that affect us.

nodes.label: Diversity Council
nodes.description: To educate people to embrace diversity as a foundation for building a healthy, inclusive and prosperous community.

nodes.label: Eastern Educational Resource Center
nodes.description: Eastern Educational Resource Collaborative's (East Ed's) mission is to serve as a resource to schools, colleges, families and agencies and support the establishment of equitable, anti-bias, multicultural environments.

nodes.label: Education for Liberation Network
nodes.description: The Education for Liberation Network is a national coalition of teachers, community activists, researchers, youth and parents who believe a good education should teach people—particularly low-income youth and youth of color—how to understand and challenge the injustices their communities face. The network aims to help improve the practice of Education for Liberation by bringing people together to learn from each other’s experiences. The network provides a space for members to share knowledge and work together to create tools for liberatory education. By building alliances that cross the boundaries of geography, occupation and age we hope to nurture communities of thoughtful, socially-engaged people and to maximize the impact of their work.

nodes.label: Educators' Network for Social Justice Milwaukee
nodes.description: We are an organization of educators including classroom teachers, teacher educators, and community activists, who strive for educational justice

nodes.label: Educolor
nodes.description: EduColor seeks to elevate the voices of public school advocates of color on educational equity and justice.

nodes.label: Fellowship for Race and Equity in Education
nodes.description: Our mission is to support individuals and institutions as they take on our most intractable race, equity, diversity, and inclusion (REDI) problems, accelerating our transition toward a more liberatory, community-centered society that values the gifts and potential of all of its members.

nodes.label: Free Minds, Free People
nodes.description: Free Minds, Free People is a national conference that brings together teachers, young people, researchers, parents and community-based activists/educators from across the country to build a movement to develop and promote education as a tool for liberation.

nodes.label: Gay Lesbian and Straight Education Network
nodes.description: Every day GLSEN works to ensure that LGBTQ students are able to learn and grow in a school environment free from bullying and harassment.

nodes.label: Global Glimpse
nodes.description: Inspire America's next generation to become responsible global citizens through leadership, community service and immersion in the developing world.

nodes.label: Mosaic Project
nodes.description: We work toward a peaceful future by uniting children of diverse backgrounds, providing them with essential community building skills, and empowering them to become peacemakers.

nodes.label: New York Collective of Radical Educators
nodes.description: New York Collective of Radical Educators (NYCoRE) is a group of current and former public school educators and their allies committed to fighting for social justice in our school system and society at large, by organizing and mobilizing teachers, developing curriculum, and working with community, parent, and student organizations.

nodes.label: Not in Our School
nodes.description: Not in Our School's mission is to stop hate, adress bullying, and build safe, inclusive communities for all.

nodes.label: NYCLU Teen Activist Project
nodes.description: The New York Civil Liberties Union (NYCLU) is one of the nation's foremost defenders of civil liberties and civil rights.

nodes.label: One Nation Indivisible
nodes.description: One Nation Indivisible harnesses the power of storytelling and strategic organizing to support and celebrate people struggling to create, sustain and improve racially, culturally, linguistically and socioeconomically integrated schools, communities, workplaces and social institutions.

nodes.label: Partners Against Hate
nodes.description: Partners Against Hate was a collaborative project of the Anti-Defamation League, The Leadership Conference Education Fund, and the Center for Preventing Hate, which offered promising education and counteraction strategies for young people and the wide range of community-based professionals who work and interact with youth, including parents, law enforcement officials, educators, and community/business leaders.

nodes.label: Pillars of Peace Hawaii
nodes.description: We hope to inspire people--from keiki (children) to kupuna (elders)--to cultivate compassion, mindfulness and justice in their daily lives and better understand the roles of diversity and culture in the practice of peace.

nodes.label: Project S.E.E.D
nodes.description: S.E.E.D. participants build a close knit community to explore their experiences and expand their understanding of social identity, power, oppression, privilege, and diversity.

nodes.label: Radical Math
nodes.description: RadicalMath is a resource for educators interested in integrating issues of social and economic justice into their math classes and curriculum.

nodes.label: Rethinking Schools
nodes.description: Rethinking Schools began as a local effort to address problems such as basal readers, standardized testing, and textbook-dominated curriculum.

nodes.label: Stand for Children
nodes.description: Stand for Children's mission is to ensure that all children, regardless of their background, graduate from high school prepared for, and with access to, a college education.

nodes.label: Teachers 4 Social Justice
nodes.description: Our mission is to provide opportunities for self-transformation, leadership, and community building to educators in order to affect meaningful change in the classroom, school, community and society.

nodes.label: Teachers For Social Justice
nodes.description: Teachers for Social Justice (TSJ) is an organization of teachers, administrators, pre-service teachers, and other educators working in public, independent, alternative, and charter schools and universities in the Chicago area that have come together based on their commitment to education for social justice.

nodes.label: Teaching for Change
nodes.description: Teaching for Change provides teachers and parents with the tools to create schools where students learn to read, write and change the world.

nodes.label: Teaching Tolerance (SPLC)
nodes.description: Teaching Tolerance provides free resources to educators—teachers, administrators, counselors and other practitioners—who work with children from kindergarten through high school.

nodes.label: Understanding Prejudice
nodes.description: The purpose of the site is to offer educational resources and information on prejudice, discrimination, multiculturalism, and diversity, with the ultimate goal of reducing the level of intolerance and bias in contemporary society.

nodes.label: Until We are All Free
nodes.description: Launched in 2015, UNTIL WE ARE ALL FREE is an unprecedented collaboration between CultureStrike, Mobilize the Immigrant Vote, and Black Alliance for Just Immigration, responding to the call from Black leaders for immigrant and refugee rights advocates to boldly address racial justice and show up for Black lives.

nodes.label: We Unify
nodes.description: WeUnify is about bringing unlikeminded people together because it’s fun, and our democracy needs it.

nodes.label: Youth Together
nodes.description: Grounded in our commitment to peace, unity and justice, the mission of Youth Together is to address the root causes of educational inequities by developing multiracial youth leaders and engaging school community allies to promote positive school change.

nodes.label: YWCA Metropolitan Chicago Racial Justice, Equity and Inclusion Project
nodes.description: YWCA is dedicated to eliminating racism, empowering women and promoting peace, justice, freedom and dignity for all.

nodes.label: YWCA Columbus
nodes.description: YWCA is dedicated to eliminating racism, empowering women and promoting peace, justice, freedom and dignity for all.

nodes.label: YWCA Madison
nodes.description: YWCA Madison works every day to eliminate racism and empower women, through programs in race & gender equity, job training & transportation, and housing & shelter, we create real change for women, families and communities.

nodes.label: YWCA York
nodes.description: YWCA YORK IS DEDICATED TO ELIMINATING RACISM, EMPOWERING WOMEN, STRENGTHENING FAMILIES AND PROMOTING PEACE, JUSTICE, FREEDOM AND DIGNITY FOR ALL.

nodes.label: Zinn Education Project
nodes.description: The Zinn Education Project promotes and supports the teaching of people’s history in classrooms across the country.

nodes.label: Impact Justice
nodes.description: Impact Justice is committed to fostering a more humane, responsive, and restorative system of justice in our nation.

nodes.label: Ben Franklin Circles
nodes.description: The Ben Franklin Circles (BFC) is a collaborative project of 92nd Street Y (92Y), the Hoover Institution, and Citizen University that reflects a shared commitment to fostering civic participation, open dialogue, and ethics-based leadership.

nodes.label: Better Angels
nodes.description: By bringing red and blue Americans together into a working alliance, we’re building new ways to talk to one another, participate together in public life, and influence the direction of the nation.

nodes.label: Beyond Differences
nodes.description: Inspire students at all middle schools nationwide to end social isolation and create a culture of belonging for everyone

nodes.label: Campus Compact
nodes.description: Campus Compact advances the public purposes of colleges and universities by deepening their ability to improve community life and to educate students for civic and social responsibility

nodes.label: Citizen University
nodes.description: Citizen University is a national platform for fostering responsible and empowered citizenship through activation, communication, and education.

nodes.label: Encore.org
nodes.description: The decades of life beyond 50 become a time of social contribution and impact — and we leave the world better than we found it.

nodes.label: Essential partners
nodes.description: Our Mission: To foster constructive dialogue where conflicts are driven by differences in identity, beliefs & values.

nodes.label: Generation Citizen
nodes.description: GENERATION CITIZEN (GC) WORKS TO ENSURE THAT EVERY STUDENT IN THE UNITED STATES RECEIVES AN EFFECTIVE ACTION CIVICS EDUCATION, WHICH PROVIDES THEM WITH THE KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS NECESSARY TO PARTICIPATE IN OUR DEMOCRACY AS ACTIVE CITIZENS.

nodes.label: Heterodox Academy
nodes.description: OpenMind is a free, interactive, psychology-based platform designed to foster intellectual humility, empathy, and mutual understanding across a variety of differences.

nodes.label: Interfaith Youth Core
nodes.description: A national non-profit organization working towards an America where people of different faiths, worldviews, and traditions can bridge differences and find common values to build a shared life together.

nodes.label: Narrative4
nodes.description: Our work - rooted in the N4 story exchange - equips people to use their stories to build empathy, shatter stereotypes, break down barriers, and - ultimately - make the world a better place.

nodes.label: National Institute for Civil Discourse
nodes.description: The National Institute for Civil Discourse integrates research, practice and policy to support and engage:   Elected officials who are capable of working to solve the big issues facing our country. A public that demands civil discourse as well as government that works in the best interests of the country as a whole.  A media that informs citizens in a fair and responsible way.

nodes.label: One America Movement
nodes.description: The One America Movement’s mission is to build bridges and solve problems by bringing Americans together across racial, religious, political and geographic divides to address pressing social problems – poverty, opioids, racial tension and more.

nodes.label: People's supper
nodes.description: We aim to repair the breach in our interpersonal relationships across political, ideological, and identity differences, leading to more civil discourse.

nodes.label: Resetting the table
nodes.description: Resetting the Table is dedicated to building meaningful dialogue and deliberation across political and communal divides.

nodes.label: Seeds of Peace
nodes.description: We inspire and cultivate new generations of global leaders in communities divided by conflict.

nodes.label: Sisterhood of Salaam Shalom
nodes.description: We grow relationships between Muslim and Jewish women to build bridges and fight hate, negative stereotyping and prejudice.

nodes.label: Spaceship Media
nodes.description: Reducing polarization, building communities, restoring trust in media.

nodes.label: StoryCorps
nodes.description: StoryCorps’ mission is to preserve and share humanity’s stories in order to build connections between people and create a more just and compassionate world.

nodes.label: Streetlaw
nodes.description: Street Law, Inc. advances justice through classroom and community education programs that empower people with the legal and civic knowledge, skills, and confidence to bring about positive change for themselves and others.

nodes.label: Village Square
nodes.description: We are dedicated to maintaining factual accuracy in civic and political debate by growing civil discourse on divisive issues, and recalling the history and principles at the foundation of our democracy.

nodes.label: Welcoming America
nodes.description: Welcoming America provides the roadmap and support they need to become more inclusive toward immigrants and all residents.

nodes.label: Maynard Institute
nodes.description: The Robert C. Maynard Institute for Journalism Education is the nation’s oldest organization dedicated to helping the news media accurately portray all segments of society, particularly those often overlooked, such as communities of color.

nodes.label: Troll Busters
nodes.description: We are Team TrollBusters. When you spot online violence, online abuse or other troll behavior, send an S.O.S. and we will be your first responders online, supporting you with:  personal endorsements just-in-time coaching and reputation repair services

nodes.label: Gather
nodes.description: The mission: make journalism more responsive to the public’s needs and more inclusive of the public’s voices and diversity, by helping journalists, educators, and students who share these values find each other, find resources and best practices, and find support and mentorship.

nodes.label: Journalism that Matters
nodes.description: Journalism That Matters fosters inclusive civic communications so that people, communities and democracy thrive.

nodes.label: Color of Change
nodes.description: We help people respond effectively to injustice in the world around us.

nodes.label: Trust Project
nodes.description: The Trust Project, a consortium of top news companies led by award-winning journalist Sally Lehrman, is developing transparency standards that help you easily assess the quality and credibility of journalism.

nodes.label: Coral Project
nodes.description: The Coral Project brings journalists and the communities they serve closer together through open-source tools and strategies.

nodes.label: Hearken
nodes.description: Our company helps news organizations listen to the public as a story develops from pitch to publication

nodes.label: GroundSourced
nodes.description: GroundSource helps you reach audiences and communities where they prefer to communicate: on their phones, in a conversation.

nodes.label: Listening Post
nodes.description: The Listening Post Collective offers resources, tools, peer-to-peer support and a shared learning space for journalists, newsroom leaders and community groups looking to revitalize their local news and information ecosystems.

nodes.label: Jefferson Center
nodes.description: Our mission is to strengthen democracy by advancing informed, citizen-developed solutions to challenging public issues.

nodes.label: Outlier Media
nodes.description: Outlier Media is a Detroit-based service journalism organization that identifies, reports, and delivers valuable information to empower residents to hold landlords, municipal government and elected officials accountable for longstanding problems in the housing and utilities markets.

nodes.label: City Bureau
nodes.description: Bring journalists and community members together in a collaborative spirit to produce equitable media coverage, encourage civic participation and hold powerful forces to account.

nodes.label: Youth Wire
nodes.description: YouthWire provides media training to disconnected youth, amplifies youth voices to influence policy at local and statewide levels through digital and print publications, and encourages civic engagement through storytellling.

nodes.label: 100 Days in Appalachia
nodes.description: Weary of the influx of bus tours and parachuting journalists seeking insights into rural America, we launched 100 Days to push back on the national narratives that had reduced our region to a handful of narrow stories.

nodes.label: Solutions Journalism Network
nodes.description: to spread the practice of solutions journalism: rigorous and compelling reporting about responses to social problems

nodes.label: Coding it Forward
nodes.description: Empowering the next generation of technology leaders to create social change.

nodes.label: GirlsWhoCode
nodes.description:
Girls Who Code was founded with a single mission:
to close the gender gap in technology

nodes.label: Center for Civic Media at Emerson College
Code for America
nodes.description: A national nonprofit dedicated to applying the principles and practices of modern technology and service design to the machinery of government.

nodes.label: Harvard Kennedy School Center for Democratic Governance and Innovation
Irene W. and C.B. Pennington Foundation
P2P Foundation
nodes.description: researching, cataloging and advocating for the potential of P2P and Commons-based approaches to societal and consciousness change

nodes.label: The Coexist Initiative
nodes.description: promote primary school enrolment and retention of girls in the Daadab and Kakuma refugee camps

nodes.label: Center for Civic Design
nodes.description: The Center for Civic Design works to ensure that voter experiences are positive with the assistance of design elements in voter information guides, ballots, poll worker materials, and other election forms.

nodes.label: Civic Hall
nodes.description: Civic Hall is a year-round community center for civic tech and innovation that offers members a daily home for collaborative work, timely events, and actionable research.
